content: anthro-inspired scarflet note this scarf was something i wanted to make and knew i could figure out when i initially made it available as a pattern it was because i figured others would like to make it too as i am not a pattern designer it was merely my notes that made sense to me after a few years and numerous questions and some complaints i reknit the scarf and tried to make the instructions easier to understand this pattern has been revised to reflect those changes as an aside i think i might like it even better if the leaf part was a bit larger also many have mentioned that 12 5 is not long enough for the neck part i agree at the time i only had single skeins of chamonix and attempted to get a full scarf from each i hope you enjoy making it as much as i did materials heavy worsted/aran to chunky weight yarn approximately 120 150 yards on size 8 us needles i used jaeger chamonix discontinued first leaf starting at tip of point cast on 2 stitches row 1 kfb knit in front and back of 1st stitch - 1st increase k next st 3 sts row 2 kfb p1 k1 4 sts row 3 kfb k1 p1 to last stitch k1 5 sts row 4 kfb p3 k1 6 sts row 5 kfb p1 k1 2 times k1 7 sts row 6 kfb p5 k1 8 sts row 7 kfb k1 p1 3 times k1 9 sts row 8 kfb p7 k1 10 sts row 9 kfb p1 k1 4 times 11 11 sts row 10 kfb p9 k1 12 sts row 11 kfb k1 p1 5 times k1 13 sts row 12 kfb p11 k1 14 sts row 13 kfb p1 k1 6 times k1 15 sts row 14 kfb p13 k1 16 sts row 15 kfb k1 p1 7 times k1 17 sts row 16 kfb p15 k1 18 sts row 17 kfb p1 k1 8 times k1 19 sts row 18 kfb p17 k1 20 sts row 19 kfb k1 p1 9 times k1 21 sts row 20 kfb p19 k1 22 sts row 21 kfb p1 k1 10 times k1 23 sts row 22 kfb p21 k1 24 sts row 23 kfb k1 p1 11 times k1 25 sts row 24 kfb p23 k1 26 sts note if you desire a larger leaf continue increasing one stitch per row to desired width incorporating pattern as above work even as follows row 25 k1 p1 k1 11 times k1 26 sts row 26 k1 p24 k1 26 sts repeat row 25 & 26 5 times or until leaf measures approximately 5 if you made your leaf wider then change length accordingly as well keep track of row so that second leaf will be the same length divide for loop opening *k1 slip next stitch onto a stitch holder repeat from * across every other stitch will be on
